page.title: 11*** HISTORY OF HASWELL. **
page.content: Haswell is 6 miles East of Durham city. It had a coalmine from 1835 to 1896. The village had about 4000 inhabitants when the mine was working.In 1844 it exploded and killed 95 men and boys.Michael Faraday came and stayed in Haswell to find the cause of the explosion.He decided that it was an act of God and no compensation was paid.Karl Marx's daughter wrote a sad song about the disaster.Haswell mine was the first in the world to have wire rope and steel cages to raise and lower the men and the coal.Before that men were lowered like a bucket is lowered down a well.From the closure of the mine to nowadays many Haswell families have left to work in other areas.Many shops and businesses have closed down.Now Haswell is a residential village.
